sense.name: Cut at or be cut at, possibly incidentely removing small pieces.
sense.commentary: Includes: CHIP AT, CHIP OFF Note: Nothing new is formed by the chipping action; compare to Sense 3.
sense.examples: Her tooth chipped. The boys chipped at the surface of the tree with pocketknives. A big chunk of her knee joint chipped off.

sense.name: Play a chip shot, as in golf.
sense.examples: Woods chipped a couple of great shots during the tournament. The golfer, upset, violently chipped at the ball before finally putting it on the green.

sense.name: Form or engrave by chipping.
sense.examples: They chipped their names in the stone. It's not proper to chip one's name into trees, Jimmy. He chipped at the stone until it resembled a horse.

sense.name: CHIP AWAY (AT): remove or withdraw gradually in prominence or function.
sense.commentary: Is: CHIP AWAY (AT) Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CHIP AWAY (AT) NP2[patient[abstract]]
sense.examples: These new customs are chipping away at the general quality of life. He chipped away at ad agency compensation. Current US policies chip away national and international security.

sense.name: CHIP IN: contribute to some cause.
sense.examples: I chip in at the office, don't I? A local politician has been chipping in at Little League. All of my friends chipped in and paid for my birthday dinner.
